Blog.post: If you want to see more pictures of the funeral, please go to http://groups.msn.com/PicturesbyRebekah
urlLink The procession takes off to the Capitol with a President this era will never forget. urlLink
urlLink Mrs. Reagan gracefully walks back to the car to follow her husband to the Capitol. urlLink
urlLink The casket is fasten tightly to the carriage. urlLink
urlLink The riderless horse with the boots backward symbolizes a fallen hero. urlLink
urlLink The casket is placed on the carriage. urlLink
urlLink Reagan's casket is taken out of the Hirst. urlLink
urlLink The empty carriage. urlLink
urlLink The horse procession waits patiently. urlLink
urlLink The Color Guard and Honory Pallbearers wait for the change. urlLink
urlLink President Reagan is placed on the carriage. urlLink
urlLink A remembrance of the day that will not be forgotten. urlLink
urlLink 400 stars representing 400,000 who died. urlLink
urlLink A picture of the dedication of those who have fought for our freedom over the past 250 years. urlLink
urlLink Becki, Anne, Bonnie and Amanda share in the memory of the WWII dedication. urlLink
urlLink The View from the South Lawn. urlLink
urlLink Another view of the Oval Office from the Rose Garden. urlLink
urlLink The Rose Garden is full of Tulips. urlLink
urlLink The President walking towards the Oval Office. urlLink
urlLink Marine One departing the South Lawn. urlLink
urlLink The PPO Interns had the chance to meet with Senator Frist before our internship was over. Here we are on the steps of the capitol waiting for the picture. urlLink
urlLink The Oval Office during the spring while the cherry bloosoms where blooming. urlLink
urlLink Waiting for the President to step out of Marine One. urlLink
urlLink While attending a the introduction of seven countries into NATO, I was able to meet Secretary of Defense, Donald Rummsfled urlLink
urlLink As a White House Intern, I had the opportunity to hear many great speakers such as Dr. Rice. urlLink
Noticed how the moon shines so bright when it seems to be the darkest of nights?
urlLink How can you not help yourself from melting with a glance from a kind and caring man? urlLink
urlLink A picture is worth a thousand words. urlLink
urlLink This is Secretary Jackson at a Bowie Baysox game throwing the first pitch. urlLink
